question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration.
Please help me implement the following requirement using code. Create using SVG code: a gray game controller with purple buttons.

checklist.title: Is the SVG game controller correctly structured and defined?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG has a proper viewport/viewBox setup, correct use of SVG namespaces, and appropriate dimensions for display. Check if the base structure uses proper SVG elements (rect, path, circle, etc.) for the controller body. Deduct 5 points for missing viewBox, 5 points for improper dimensions, and 5 points for incorrect SVG structure. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the game controller visually accurate and recognizable?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG resembles a standard game controller with recognizable features (d-pad, analog sticks, action buttons, shoulder buttons). Score 0 if the shape is unrecognizable as a controller, 5 if it has basic controller features but with proportional issues, and 10 if it accurately depicts a realistic game controller with proper proportions.

checklist.title: Are the specified colors correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the controller body uses gray color and the buttons use purple color as specified in the requirements. The gray should be an appropriate shade (not too dark or too light) and the purple should be visually distinct. Deduct 5 points if the gray color isn't used for the body, 5 points if the buttons aren't purple, and 3 points if the shades chosen are inappropriate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the SVG include visual details and depth effects?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the implementation includes visual details like gradients, shadows, highlights, or other techniques to create a 3D effect or depth for the controller. Deduct 5 points for completely flat design without any depth cues, 3 points for minimal depth effects, and give full 10 points for professional-level shading and depth effects.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is well-formed, valid, and compatible with standard browsers. Check for proper closing tags, valid attribute values, and absence of errors. Code with strong robustness should be able to render correctly across different browsers and contexts, giving 10 points. If there are minor issues that don't affect rendering, give 5 points, and if there are critical issues that break rendering, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive button press animations 2. Glowing effects 3. Creative interpretations of a game controller). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or groups that serve no purpose 2. Excessive detail that increases file size without visual benefit 3. Unnecessary animations or effects that distract from the main visual. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visualization is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review proper organization of SVG elements (logical grouping), use of reusable components, and optimization for file size. Deduct 5 points if elements aren't logically grouped; deduct 5 points if there's excessive code duplication instead of reusable patterns; deduct 5 points if the SVG isn't optimized (unnecessary decimal points, verbose paths). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Consistent stroke widths 2) Proper proportions between elements 3) Professional finish without jagged edges. Deduct 3 points for inconsistent stroke widths, 5 points for disproportionate elements, and 5 points for poor edge quality. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there interactivity or potential for animation?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG includes or is structured to allow for interactivity or animations: 1) Button states that could be animated 2) Elements with proper IDs for targeting with JavaScript 3) Organized layers that could be independently animated. Deduct 5 points if the SVG structure prevents easy animation, 3 points if only basic hover effects are possible, and 5 points if the SVG has no elements that could be targeted for interaction. The full score is 10 points.
